1 """
2 Unittest for the board_pid controller package
3 
4 Inputs
5  BoardPid - calls the BoardPid class in the board_pid package
6 
7 """
8 import rospy
9 import unittest
10 import time
11 from board_pid import BoardPid
12 
13 class ControllerTest(unittest.TestCase):
14  def testcontrollerforzero(self):
15  """ Sets the controller gains to 0 and checks whether the package returns a 0
16  """
17  Kp = 0
18  Ki = 0
19  Kd = 0
20  target = 255
21  controller = BoardPid(
22  kp=Kp,
23  kd=Kd,
24  ki = Ki,
25  target=target
26  )
27 
28  value = 2
29  self.assertEquals(controller.get(value),0)
30 
31  def testcontrollertargetzero(self):
32  """ Tests for when target and current position is the same
33  The controller should return a zero
34  """
35  Kp = 32
36  Ki = 4
37  Kd = 1
38  target = 255
39  controller = BoardPid(
40  kp=Kp,
41  kd=Kd,
42  ki = Ki,
43  target=target
44  )
45 
46  value = 255
47  self.assertEquals(controller.get(value),0)
48 
49  def testcontrollerproportional(self):
50  """ Tests for proportional error gain
51  """
52  Kp = 1
53  Ki = 0
54  Kd = 0
55  target = 0
56  controller = BoardPid(
57  kp=Kp,
58  kd=Kd,
59  ki=Ki,
60  target=target
61  )
62 
63  value = 1
64  self.assertEquals(controller.get(value),-1.0)
65 
66  def testcontrollerintegral(self):
67  """ Tests for integral error gain
68  """
69  Kp = 0
70  Ki = 1
71  Kd = 0
72  target = 0
73  controller = BoardPid(
74  kp=Kp,
75  kd=Kd,
76  ki=Ki,
77  target=target
78  )
79  controller.get(1)
80  time.sleep(1)
81  self.assertAlmostEquals(controller.get(1),-0.5, delta=0.01)
82 
83  def testcontrollerderivative(self):
84  """ Tests for derivative error gain
85  """
86  Kp = 0
87  Ki = 0
88  Kd = 1
89  target = 0
90  controller = BoardPid(
91  kp=Kp,
92  kd=Kd,
93  ki=Ki,
94  target=target
95  )
96  controller.get(0)
97  time.sleep(1)
98  self.assertAlmostEquals(controller.get(1),-1.0, delta=0.01)
99

102 if __name__ == "__main__":
103  import rosunit
104  rosunit.unitrun('balance_board', 'ControllerTest', ControllerTest)
